item.title: Install
item.description: Linux on Intel, AMD64 Linux on ARM64 macOS Intel CPU macOS Apple CPU Docker Windows Intel, AMD64 Windows ARM Compile from Source Linux on Intel, AMD64 Download, untar curl -sL https://github.com/x186k/deadsfu/releases/latest/download/deadsfu-linux-amd64.tar.gz | tar xvz Jump to Starting DeadSFU. Linux on ARM64 Download, untar curl -sL https://github.com/x186k/deadsfu/releases/latest/download/deadsfu-linux-arm64.tar.gz | tar xvz Jump to Starting DeadSFU. macOS Intel CPU Download, untar curl -sL https://github.com/x186k/deadsfu/releases/latest/download/deadsfu-darwin-amd64.tar.gz | tar xvz Jump to Starting DeadSFU.

item.title: Browser-in and Browser-out
item.description: Start the SFU: You should have a file: deadsfu or deadsfu.exe, or Docker image ready. Linux or macOS Windows Using Docker ./deadsfu https://cameron42.ddns5.com:8443 ./deadsfu.exe https://cameron42.ddns5.com:8443 docker run --network host x186k/deadsfu /app/main https://cameron42.ddns5.com:8443 The SFU will print some informational mesages. Wait 5-20 seconds for this message: HTTPS READY: Certificate Acquired Open your browser to the console: https://cameron42.ddns5.com:8443 Your SFU is now ready to use. ðŸ’¡ Instead of cameron42, you can choose another hostname.

item.title: OBS-in, Browser-out with FTL
item.description: Start the SFU: You should have a deadsfu or deadsfu.exe, or be pulled the Docker image. Linux or macOS Windows Using Docker # you can use your name+number if you like ./deadsfu https://cameron42.ddns5.com:8443 # you can use your name+number if you like ./deadsfu.exe https://cameron42.ddns5.com:8443 docker run --network host x186k/deadsfu /app/main https://cameron42.ddns5.com:8443 Wait for the HTTPS-certificate to be aquired: The first time aquiring the cert it can take a little while.
